title: Mosque

adjectives: Of or relating to or supporting Islamism
verbs: To love unquestioningly and uncritically or to excess; to treat or pursue with devotion or adoration.
To venerate someone or something as an idol.
Love unquestioningly and uncritically or to excess; venerate as an idol
To make an idol of, or to worship as an idol.
nouns: Believer of Islam.
A Muslim or Moslem is an adherent of the religion of Islam.
A believer in or follower of Islam
A person who is a follower and believer of Islam.
A Muslim, sometimes spelled Moslem, is a follower of the religion of Islam, a monotheistic Abrahamic religion based on the Quran.
Adherent of Islam
An adherent of the religion of Islam.
A mosque, sometimes spelt mosk, is a place of worship for followers of Islam.
A place of worship for Muslims, often having at least one minaret; a masjid.
Or Islamic Center -- the place of Muslim prayer
(Islam) a Muslim place of worship that usually has a minaret
Place of worship for followers of Islam
A place of worship for followers of the Islamic faith.
A place of worship for Muslims.
Act of religious devotion
The devotion accorded to a deity or to a sacred object.
An act of worship.
Devotion accorded to a deity or to a sacred object.
The activity of worshipping
Worship is an act of religious devotion usually directed towards a deity.
Worship is an act of spiritual or religious devotion usually directed towards a deity, divine essence, ideal, or specific being.
A minaret is a distinctive architectural feature of mosques, generally a tall spire with an onion-shaped or conical crown, usually either free standing or taller than associated support structure.
Distinctive architectural feature of mosques
A tall, graceful spire with onion-shaped crowns distinctive to Islamic mosques.
Known as manara (?????, but more usually ?????) in Arabic
A monotheistic Abrahamic religion based on the teachings of Muhammad; its central text is the Qur'an; its followers are Muslims.
A religion based on the teachings of the prophet Muhammad.
The monotheistic religious system of Muslims founded in Arabia in the 7th century and based on the teachings of Muhammad as laid down in the Koran
Islamism or political Islam is a set of ideologies holding that "Islam should guide social and political as well as personal life".
A set of political ideologies
The religion introduced by Muhammad: Islam.
Islam is a Abrahamic religion originating with prophet Muhammad, a 7th century Arab, and centered on the religious text known as the Qur `an.
Monotheistic and Abrahamic religion articulated by the Qur'an

Islam is a monotheistic and Abrahamic religion articulated by the Qur `an, a book considered by its adherents to be the verbatim word of God and by the teachings and normative example of Muhammad, considered by them to be the last prophet of God.

description: A mosque building, a place of worship for followers of Islam. Shown with a domed roof and a minaret.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the mosque emoji is depicted with elegant architectural details, featuring graceful domes and slender minarets, all rendered with Apple's characteristic realistic lighting and subtle 3D depth. The design emphasizes a sense of serenity and spiritual significance, with smooth gradients and soft rounded edges contributing to its peaceful aesthetic. This emoji serves as a visual representation of Islamic faith, religious gatherings, or places of worship, often conveying a message of peace and devotion.
